intro: Uragoga soteropolitana, commonly known as the Soteropolitan uragoga, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Soterra. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Its blooming season occurs during the late spring to early summer months. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under local conservation laws.
